title: Add actionable weather warnings (umbrella, warm clothes, stay hydrated) with emojis

requirements.text: Update the weather advice generation so that, based on current weather conditions, the app shows actionable warnings/advice in English that include at least: “Carry an umbrella”, “Wear warm clothes”, and “Stay hydrated”, with relevant emojis included in the user-facing title/message text.

quotes: Wait I said u to add warnings like carry an umbrella,wear warm clothes,stay hydrated etc..

acceptanceCriteria: When current conditions indicate rain/drizzle/showers, the advice title/message explicitly tells the user to carry an umbrella and includes umbrella-related emoji(s).
When current conditions indicate snow or very cold temperature, the advice title/message explicitly tells the user to wear warm clothes and includes cold/clothing emoji(s).
When current conditions indicate hot temperature, the advice title/message explicitly tells the user to stay hydrated and includes water/heat emoji(s).
All advice/warning copy is in English.

requirements.text: Ensure the weather advice banner renders the advice title and message exactly as provided (including emojis) without truncation, and with readable wrapping in both light and dark mode.

quotes: add warnings like carry an umbrella,wear warm clothes,stay hydrated etc..

acceptanceCriteria: Advice titles and messages (including emojis) are fully visible and wrap gracefully on mobile and desktop.
No layout regressions in light mode or dark mode when rendering longer advice messages.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths (compose existing hooks/components instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Adding a weekly weather summary (not requested in the latest user message).
Introducing new third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
